channel.title: 华尔街日报
channel.description: 这是一个追踪华尔街日报news的种子

item.title: 亚马逊药房将为通过生产商礼来公司新的直接面向消费者服务订购的减肥药 Zepbound 开具处方
item.description:
Amazon Pharmacy will fill prescriptions for the weight-loss drug Zepbound ordered through maker Eli Lilly’s new direct-to-consumer service https://t.co/floRTnweXh

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 13, 2024

item.title: 街谈巷议通胀再次走高，美联储何时开始缩表已不那么重要，更重要的是他们最终会在哪里缩表
item.description:
Heard on the Street: After another warm inflation reading, focus less on when the Fed will start cutting and more on where they will end up https://t.co/prp3WeDkqq

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 13, 2024

item.title: 科学研究因复制或篡改图像而遭到破坏。Imagetwin和Proofig等软件品牌让识别欺骗变得更加容易。
item.description:
Scientific studies are getting busted for copied or doctored images. Software brands such as Imagetwin and Proofig are making it easier to spot deceptions. https://t.co/vMEsHUtKXv

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 13, 2024

item.title: 众议院共和党的竞选部门表示，共和党人应该公开讨论他们对堕胎的立场，而不是试图回避这个问题
item.description:
The House GOP’s campaign arm says Republicans should openly discuss their positions on abortion, rather than try to sidestep the issue https://t.co/TCC70wAhE1

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 13, 2024

item.title: 美国总统拜登和前总统唐纳德-特朗普在周二举行的最新一轮初选投票中赢得了足够的代表席位，成为各自党派的推定提名人
item.description:
President Biden and former President Donald Trump won enough delegates to become the presumptive nominees of their parties in the latest round of primary voting Tuesday https://t.co/RKS91Wg09o

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 13, 2024

item.title: 特别法律顾问罗伯特-赫尔（Robert Hur）在立法者面前作证时辩称，党派政治与他对拜登总统的评价无关，他认为拜登总统是一位记忆力差的老人
item.description:
In testimony before lawmakers, Special Counsel Robert Hur contended that partisan politics had no role in his assessment of President Biden as an elderly man with a poor memory https://t.co/V2ocAxfdAK

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 13, 2024

item.title: 您的性生活还能更好吗？试试这些来自长者的性爱建议吧。
item.description:
Could your sex life be better? Try this sex advice from seniors. https://t.co/Ezp3kswgqz https://t.co/Ezp3kswgqz

item.title: 没有照片，就没有账单。这是越来越多的司机为躲避高速公路收费而采取的办法，他们用篡改或遮挡车牌的方式躲避摄像头。
item.description:
No photo, no bill. That’s the approach more drivers are taking to dodge highway tolls, avoiding cameras with doctored or covered-up license plates. https://t.co/l7D5NeNlZa https://t.co/l7D5NeNlZa

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 13, 2024

item.title: 观看：由于几乎没有卡车能够完成向加沙巴勒斯坦人运送援助物资的危险旅程，美国正在加强人道主义空投。@bcsolomon 与美国空军一起执行运送食物的任务。
item.description:
Watch: With few trucks able to make the dangerous journey to deliver aid to Palestinians in Gaza, the U.S. is ramping up humanitarian airdrops. @bcsolomon flew with the U.S. Air Force on a mission to deliver food. https://t.co/wNCyf3A2dB https://t.co/wNCyf3A2dB

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 13, 2024

item.title: 人工智能和其他行业确实膨胀了，但 Streetwise 专栏作家 @jmackin2 认为投机狂热并不明显
item.description:
AI and other sectors are inflated for sure, but Streetwise columnist @jmackin2 says speculative mania isn’t evident https://t.co/1VkaGfKS5K https://t.co/1VkaGfKS5K

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 13, 2024

item.title: 被以色列军方关押并最终未经指控获释的巴勒斯坦人告诉《日刊》，他们在被拘留期间遭到殴打、被迫保持紧张姿势并被剥夺睡眠
item.description:
Palestinians held by the Israeli military and eventually released without charges told the Journal about being beaten, forced to hold stress positions and deprived of sleep while detained https://t.co/2XQjxoD7OV https://t.co/2XQjxoD7OV

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 13, 2024

item.title: 美国及其阿拉伯和欧洲盟国本月开始加大向加沙地带空投人道主义物资的力度，但这些努力几乎无法缓解巴勒斯坦人面临的饥饿危机
item.description:
The U.S. and its Arab and European allies began ramping up humanitarian airdrops to the Gaza Strip this month, but the efforts are barely making a dent in the starvation crisis Palestinians face https://t.co/oM8WTcbdDB https://t.co/oM8WTcbdDB

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 13, 2024

item.title: 中国最大的量化基金多年来跑赢大盘，但它们没有模拟一个关键因素--中国政府
item.description:
China’s biggest quant funds beat the market for years but they didn’t model a key factor—the Chinese government https://t.co/opDgtGPPQT https://t.co/opDgtGPPQT

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 13, 2024

item.title: 科学家正在发现超加工食品如何影响我们大脑的线索
item.description:
Scientists are discovering clues to how ultra-processed food affects our brain https://t.co/pOkxPnh26Y https://t.co/pOkxPnh26Y

item.title: 欧胡岛海岸的这一悠闲地带，是威基基和夏威夷岛上其他游客众多的角落的大众旅游市场的一剂良药。以下是游览计划。
item.description:
This laid-back strip of Oahu's coast offers an antidote to the mass-market tourism of Waikiki and other heavily visited corners of the Hawaiian island. Here's how to plan a visit. https://t.co/WicF7WVuBT https://t.co/WicF7WVuBT

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 13, 2024

item.title: J.B. Smoove饰演的莱昂-布莱克用了 17 年时间才成为真正的 "热情遏制 "风格标志。
item.description:
It only took 17 years of J.B. Smoove’s Leon Black to get his due as the true “Curb Your Enthusiasm” style icon https://t.co/TNcZuixDtF https://t.co/TNcZuixDtF

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 13, 2024

item.title: 这款宾利对隐形财富并不感兴趣。它看起来就像 Bentayga 一直向往的超豪华 SUV。
item.description:
This Bentley isn’t interested in stealth wealth. It looks exactly like the over-the-top SUV that the Bentayga has always aspired to be. https://t.co/LLxal1K5Nf https://t.co/LLxal1K5Nf

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 13, 2024

item.title: 一位来自芝加哥的设计师被她的客户委以重任，这位客户刚刚在佛罗里达州购买了一套汽车公寓。"他让我设计一个最酷的男人洞穴"。
item.description:
A Chicago-based designer was assigned a monumental task by her client, who had just purchased a car condo in Florida. “He asked me to design the coolest man cave ever.” https://t.co/qIBB17bOl5 https://t.co/qIBB17bOl5

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 13, 2024

item.title: 众所周知，豪宅业主会在时尚厨房、定制装饰和艺术品上挥金如土。但是，他们越来越多地将注意力和预算转向你看不到的东西：空气。
item.description:
Luxury homeowners are known to splurge on sleek kitchens, custom décor and art. But they are increasingly turning their attention, and budgets, to something you can't see: air. https://t.co/WeJQLcyISq https://t.co/WeJQLcyISq

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 13, 2024

item.title: 伊丽莎白-卡尔是美国第一个通过体外受精技术出生的婴儿，她一直是生育技术可能性的生动象征。
item.description:
Elizabeth Carr, the first baby born by in vitro fertilization in the U.S., has always been a living symbol of fertility technology’s possibilities.

Now, the 42-year-old is the face of its challenges. https://t.co/rTJhgF13jr https://t.co/rTJhgF13jr

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 13, 2024

item.title: 在彭萨科拉市，一幢拥有泰坦尼克号房间的海滨住宅以 299.9 万美元的价格上市，房间内设有泰坦尼克号邮轮酒吧的复制品和一个设定为邮轮沉没时间的时钟。
item.description:
In Pensacola, a waterfront home with a Titanic room featuring a replica of the ocean liner’s bar and a clock set to the time the ship sank is hitting the market for $2.999 million https://t.co/dRLQgYqXFj https://t.co/dRLQgYqXFj

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 13, 2024

item.description:
Review: Tobias Menzies stars in "Manhunt," an Apple TV+ series about the effort to find President Abraham Lincoln’s assassin https://t.co/DYMQsDmDDD https://t.co/DYMQsDmDDD

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 13, 2024

Uber and Lyft encourage travelers to schedule rides ahead of time. Sounds like a win/win, right? Here’s the catch. https://t.co/csazk3tXoC https://t.co/csazk3tXoC

item.title: 十年前，在比弗利伍德花二三十万美元就能买到一栋房子。现在呢？"你不可能以低于300万美元的价格买到任何一条黄金街道上的地皮"。
item.description:
A decade ago, you could buy a house in Beverlywood for $200,000 to $300,000. Now? “You can’t buy just land on any of the prime streets for less than $3 million.” https://t.co/siQ3sbFrw6 https://t.co/siQ3sbFrw6

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 13, 2024

item.title: 价值 10 亿美元的艺术收藏品本应平均分配给一个家庭的三个子女。后来，遗嘱被更改了。八年过去了，至少 18 起诉讼，传奇仍在继续。
item.description:
A $1 billion art collection was to be divided equally among one family's three children. Then a will was changed. Eight years and at least 18 lawsuits later, the saga continues. https://t.co/jLgsZIg8uf https://t.co/jLgsZIg8uf

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 13, 2024

item.title: 一位设计专家为被称为 "蜗居 "的家庭休养所提供的秘诀："把原本可能被认为是乏善可陈的房间，变成家里最好的空间"。
item.description:
A design pro's recipe for the domestic retreat known as a "snug": "Take what might otherwise be considered the dud room and turn it into the very best space in the house." https://t.co/PIVOk6rEwr https://t.co/PIVOk6rEwr

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 13, 2024

item.title: 23andMe 曾经是最热门的创业公司之一。现在，它几乎一文不值。
item.description:
23andMe was once one of the hottest startups. Now it’s virtually worthless. https://t.co/PxBTbmtGVB https://t.co/PxBTbmtGVB
